title: Sofignano
text:
Sofignano is an Italian <a href="village">village</a> and "<a href="frazione">frazione</a>" belonging to the <a href="municipality">municipality</a> of <a href="Vaiano">Vaiano</a>, in the <a href="Province%20of%20Prato">Province of Prato</a>, <a href="Tuscany">Tuscany</a>.
Geography.
Overview.
The village of Sofignano is 2,33 <a href="kilometers">kilometers</a> from Vaiano.
It belongs Vaiano municipality together with Fabio (2,28 km), Faltugnano (2,91 km), La Briglia (1,51 km), La Cartaia (2,57 km), La Tignamica (0,47 km), Le Fornaci (3,10 km), Schignano (2,83 km)
Sofignano is spread on the mid side of the western face of the Calvana Hill and it consists of various <a href="human%20settlement">localities</a>:
Localities.
Sofignano consists of several courtyards and small villages:
Nucleus of a few houses including a <a href="school">school</a> and some <a href="houses">houses</a>.
Medieval group of houses and a church now accessible only by foot. There are stems and <a href="religious">religious</a> <a href="relics">relics</a> now left into ruin.
Fortified mansion dated 1200 now being renovated, it is the southernmost building in Sofignano.
Village perched on the mountain with several refurbished villas.
Ancient buildings and farmhouses now surrounded by few modern houses.
Between Le Fornaci and the <a href="church%20%28building%29">Church</a> the Le Fornaci, it is a group of single houses with <a href="stables">stables</a> and a few nearby <a href="cottages">cottages</a>.
Now completely renewed, this big villa and the many houses around it were built ond a medieval tower. the tower, now completely lost, was part of a triangle of towers made by this one, the San Gaudenzio Tower (then included into the villa) and the Torre del Melograno, recently re-discovered and representing the main medieval manufact in Sofignano. .
Group of houses mostly <a href="farms">farms</a>.
Other houses perched on a <a href="hill">hill</a>.
At Collisassi Il Baldino and consists of dwellings.
The proper village that names the area. Here is the <a href="parish">parish</a> of <a href="Santi%20Vito%20e%20Modesto%20in%20Sofignano">Santi Vito e Modesto in Sofignano</a> and the <a href="cemetery">cemetery</a>.
It is the most populated area, surrounding an ancient village where bricks were produced into a fornax, naming the place (Fornace = fornax). It started expanding around the old part in the 1980s and it is now considered by many the actual center of Sofignano.
